title: 108_hr4851
content:
Step 1 - Extractively Summarize the curr_chunk, try to preserve key details, and condense the text by removing irrelevant words:

"S."

Step 4: Output the summarized chunk

"S." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include a spending limitation for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. A point of order is established to ensure consistency with the spending limitation in the House of Representatives and the Senate. Waiving or suspending this point of order requires a two-thirds majority vote. The Senate requires a two-thirds majority vote to sustain an appeal of the chair's ruling on a point of order. Appeals are limited to one hour and divided between the mover and the manager of the resolution. SEC. 13. REDUCTION OF FICA RATES RESULTING FROM PERSONAL SOCIAL SECURITY SAVINGS PROGRAM. Employee Contribution: The tax rate on employees under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 will be reduced in years following a reduction year, with the reduction percentage applied. A reduction year is defined as any year after the transition year where the OASDI rate ratio exceeds 125 percent. The reduction percentage is the excess of the rate in effect under subsection (a). The OASDI rate ratio is calculated based on the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund, compared to the amount paid from these Trust Funds during the calendar year for authorized purposes. The OASDI rate ratio is calculated based on the combined balance in the Trust Funds for authorized purposes. A reduction in the tax rate imposed under subsection (a) is implemented in certain years following a reduction year. The OASDI rate ratio is calculated based on the Trust Funds balance for authorized purposes. In certain years following a reduction year, the tax rate under subsection (a) is reduced by the reduction percentage as defined in section 3101(d). The tax rate under subsection (a) cannot be reduced to less than 9.9 percent.
